Description: Bezel, in two pieces, of an integral copper alloy finger ring, bezel uninscribed and hoop incomplete. The register records 'bezel enlarged and polished for use as a mirror'.
Curator's comments: Petrie interprets this object as a "mirror ring, to enable a dandy to verify the details of his appearance" (Petrie 1886, 43). For a similar ring, see Boston, Museum of Fine Arts 88.763. Petrie, W.M.F. 1886, Naukratis. Part I., 1884–5 (third memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London, 43 Pl. XX, 34.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (p. 43, pl. XX, no. 34)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (QA.19)
